nodes.title: fix: normalize git diff paths and keep comment prompts clean
nodes.bodyText:
Fixes #83

Prioritize diff header paths to restore correct a/ / b/ prefixed filenames
Prevent newly added files from being misclassified as renames by gating oldPath
Strip alternate prefixes (c/, w/, etc.) and trailing tab metadata when decoding diff paths
Remove stray tabs from filenames so copied comment prompts no longer include leading spaces before :L1
Add regression tests that cover the updated path normalization scenarios

messageHeadline: refactor: DRY GitHub Actions workflows and pin to SHAs (#93)
messageBody:
* remove claude.yml

* chore: add npm publish CI workflow

prompt: npm publishできるCIファイルを作成して

todo: add publish.yml for npm publish

* refactor: extract common CI steps to reusable workflow

Requested task: GHAのpr.ymlとpublish.ymlがかなり被ってるのでDRYにして

Todo list completed:
- Create a shared workflow for common CI steps
- Update pr.yml to use the shared workflow
- Update publish.yml to use the shared workflow

- Extract common CI steps (lint, prettier, typecheck, test, build) to ci.yml
- Update pr.yml to use the reusable workflow
- Update publish.yml to run CI first, then publish with minimal duplication

* chore: pin GitHub Actions to specific SHAs for security

Requested task: "Require actions to be pinned to a full-length commit SHA" に耐えられるように既存のCIファイル全部SHAでpinして

Todo list completed:
- Pin actions/checkout to SHA in all workflow files
- Pin actions/setup-node to SHA in all workflow files
- Pin pnpm/action-setup to SHA in all workflow files

Pinned versions:
- actions/checkout@08eba0b27e820071cde6df949e0beb9ba4906955 # v4.3.0
- actions/setup-node@49933ea5288caeca8642d1e84afbd3f7d6820020 # v4.4.0
- pnpm/action-setup@eae0cfeb286e66ffb5155f1a79b90583a127a68b # v2.4.1
- actions/cache@2f8e54208210a422b2efd51efaa6bd6d7ca8920f # v3.3.3

* perf: limit performance workflow to src changes

Add paths filter to only run performance tests when:
- Source code in src/ directory changes
- Performance workflow itself is modified

This avoids unnecessary performance tests for documentation,
CI config, or other non-code changes.

nodes.title: refactor: DRY GitHub Actions workflows and pin to SHAs
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Extract common CI steps into reusable workflow to eliminate duplication
Pin all GitHub Actions to specific SHAs for security compliance
Ready for "Require actions to be pinned to a full-length commit SHA" policy

Changes
Workflow Refactoring

Created .github/workflows/ci.yml as a reusable workflow containing common CI steps
Updated pr.yml to use the shared workflow
Updated publish.yml to use the shared workflow and run CI before publishing

Security Improvements

Pinned all actions to full-length commit SHAs:

actions/checkout@08eba0b27e820071cde6df949e0beb9ba4906955 (v4.3.0)
actions/setup-node@49933ea5288caeca8642d1e84afbd3f7d6820020 (v4.4.0)
pnpm/action-setup@eae0cfeb286e66ffb5155f1a79b90583a127a68b (v2.4.1)
actions/cache@2f8e54208210a422b2efd51efaa6bd6d7ca8920f (v3.3.3)



Test Plan

 Verify PR checks pass with the new workflow structure
 Confirm all actions are properly pinned to SHAs
 Test that publish workflow still works correctly

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

files counter. This fix addresses two issues:

2. scripts/dev.js now properly passes through --clean flag to CLI

Fixes #91

messageHeadline: fix: prevent '.' shortcut when modifier keys are pressed (#86)
messageBody:
Modify the '.' key handler to only execute moveToCenterOfViewport when no
modifier keys (ctrl, alt, shift, meta) are pressed. This prevents
interference with other keyboard shortcuts that use '.' in combination
with modifier keys.

messageHeadline: fix comment storage structure (#78)
messageBody:
* spec

* fix: resolve TypeScript and lint errors for comment storage feature

Fixed all TypeScript and lint errors preventing commit:
- Removed unused imports (isFileContentChanged, clearViewedFiles)
- Created commentAdapter utility to convert DiffComment to Comment type
- Fixed LineNumber type compatibility issues
- Removed non-null assertions in favor of proper type guards
- Fixed unused error variables in catch blocks
- Fixed import order issues

Tasks completed:
- Fix App.tsx TypeScript errors - remove unused imports and fix type compatibility
- Fix useCombinedComments.ts - fix LineNumber type compatibility
- Fix useDiffComments.ts - fix non-null assertion error
- Fix StorageService.ts - remove non-null assertion and unused error variable
- Fix diffUtils.ts - remove unused error variable

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

* update task

* feat: simplify comment copy format and auto-mark lock files as viewed

- Simplified generatePrompt and generateAllCommentsPrompt to only include file path, line number, and content
- Added automatic detection and marking of lock files as viewed on initial load
- Added isLockFile utility function to detect common lock file patterns (package-lock.json, yarn.lock, etc.)
- Updated useViewedFiles hook to accept initial files and process lock files on mount
- Removed old TODO comment about lock file handling
- Fixed App.test.tsx to use new DiffComment format and mock useDiffComments instead of useLocalComments

This improves the user experience by:
1. Making copied comments more concise and focused on essentials
2. Automatically collapsing lock files to reduce visual clutter

- Test edge cases including special characters and multi-line bodies
- Ensure correct ordering and formatting of multiple comments

Added new keyboard shortcuts:
- { (Shift+[) jumps to the first file
- } (Shift+]) jumps to the last file

This makes it easier to quickly navigate to the beginning or end of the file list,
complementing the existing ] and [ shortcuts for next/previous file navigation.

Updated help modal to document the new shortcuts.

message:
fix: Fix syntax highlighting disappearing on hover by passing filename prop (#74)

* fix: Fix syntax highlighting disappearing on hover by passing filename prop

Pass filename as a prop through the component hierarchy instead of relying on the global currentFilename variable. This ensures each diff line uses the correct filename for language detection.

* refactor: Remove global currentFilename variable

nodes.title: fix: Fix syntax highlighting disappearing on hover by passing filename prop
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Fix syntax highlighting that disappears when hovering over files, especially with large diffs
Pass filename as a prop through the component hierarchy instead of relying on the global currentFilename variable
Remove the global currentFilename variable completely as it was causing issues

Problem
When hovering over diff lines, all lines were using the same global currentFilename variable for language detection, causing incorrect syntax highlighting. The global variable approach was fundamentally flawed as it couldn't handle multiple files being rendered simultaneously.
Solution

Added filename prop to PrismSyntaxHighlighter, EnhancedPrismSyntaxHighlighter, DiffLineRow, DiffChunk, and SideBySideDiffChunk
Pass the actual filename from DiffViewer through the component hierarchy
Each component now receives the correct filename for proper language detection
Removed the global currentFilename variable and setCurrentFilename function entirely

Why global variables were problematic
Using a global variable for filename was a mistake because:

Multiple files can be rendered at the same time in the diff view
React components can re-render in any order
The global state could be overwritten by any component, causing all components to use the wrong filename

Test plan

 Tested locally with large diffs
 Verified syntax highlighting remains stable when hovering
 All tests pass

* feat: Add performance comparison script

Create a script to compare two performance measurement results and display
the differences in a clear, readable format. Supports both Markdown and JSON
output formats.

Features:
- Compare average operation times and identify improvements/regressions
- Support for automatic detection of latest results by size
- Markdown table output with color-coded changes
- JSON output for programmatic processing
- Ability to save comparison results to file

Usage:
- pnpm compare:perf - Compare latest two medium results
- pnpm compare:perf small - Compare latest two small results
- pnpm compare:perf file1.json file2.json - Compare specific files
- pnpm compare:perf small --json - Output as JSON
- pnpm compare:perf small --save - Save markdown to file

* perf: Improve performance measurement timing accuracy

- Use setTimeout(0) before requestAnimationFrame to allow React's concurrent features to complete
- This provides more accurate measurement of actual navigation performance
- Add experimental test scripts to .gitignore

* perf: Optimize PrismSyntaxHighlighter to prevent re-renders

Add React.memo to both PrismSyntaxHighlighter and EnhancedPrismSyntaxHighlighter
components to prevent unnecessary re-renders during keyboard navigation.

Performance improvement:
- Baseline: 474.05ms average navigation time
- Optimized: 86.67ms average navigation time
- Result: 81.7% reduction in keyboard navigation latency

The optimization is particularly effective for large diffs with many syntax
highlighted code blocks, as it prevents re-rendering of unchanged code when
parent components update during navigation.

Also added useCallback for render functions to ensure proper memoization.

- This ensures consistent measurement methodology across versions
- Better handling of cases where base branch might have incompatible changes
- Add number formatting for cleaner display in Job Summary and PR comments

* fix: Install playwright in base branch if missing during CI

- Check if playwright is installed before running performance tests
- Install it temporarily with --no-save if missing
- This ensures tests can run even when base branch doesn't have playwright as a dependency

* fix: Use pnpm to install playwright in CI to handle workspace protocols

- Switch from npm to pnpm for installing playwright in base branch
- Fallback to npm if pnpm fails (for older versions)
- This fixes the 'Unsupported URL Type "link:"' error when base branch uses pnpm workspaces

* fix: Use pnpm exec instead of npx and remove npm fallback

- Use 'pnpm exec' instead of 'npx' for consistency
- Remove unnecessary npm fallback since we're already using pnpm
- Simplify the playwright installation logic

* ci: Remove PR comment functionality from performance workflow

Removed PR comment functionality from the GitHub Actions performance
workflow since it won't work from forks due to permission restrictions.
The workflow now only reports results to the Job Summary, which is
accessible to all users regardless of fork status.

nodes.title: perf: Improve keyboard navigation performance with React.memo
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
This PR optimizes the performance of keyboard navigation in large diffs by preventing unnecessary re-renders of syntax highlighter components.
Changes
Performance Optimizations

Added React.memo to PrismSyntaxHighlighter and EnhancedPrismSyntaxHighlighter components
Used useCallback for render functions to ensure proper memoization
Result: 81.7% reduction in keyboard navigation latency (474ms → 87ms)

Performance Measurement Infrastructure

Created performance measurement scripts for consistent testing
Added comparison tool to track performance changes between commits
Improved measurement timing accuracy to properly capture React rendering

CI/CD Improvements

Added GitHub Actions workflow for automated performance testing on PRs
Tests compare base vs head branch performance
Fails PR if performance degrades by >10%
Shows results in Job Summary and PR comments

Performance Results



Metric
Before
After
Improvement




Average Navigation Time
474.05ms
86.67ms
81.7% faster



The optimization is particularly effective for large diffs with many syntax highlighted code blocks.
Test Plan

 Run performance tests locally with pnpm perf
 Compare results with pnpm perf:compare
 Verify no visual or functional changes
 Test GitHub Actions workflow on this PR

messageHeadline: fix: Fix issue where last comment is not output when closing window (…
messageBody:
…#63)

## Problem
- When posting multiple comments, the last comment was not displayed in stdout
- Each time a comment was added, the old state was being sent due to useEffect cleanup

## Root Cause
- The useEffect dependency array included `comments`, causing:
  1. Previous effect cleanup to execute on each comment update
  2. Old comments state (without the new comment) to be sent
  3. New effect to be set up

## Solution
1. Client-side:
   - Use `commentsRef` to maintain reference to latest comments
   - Set up `beforeunload` event listener only once (empty dependency array)
   - Prevents unnecessary sends when adding comments

2. Server-side:
   - Add 100ms delay when SSE connection closes
   - Ensures `sendBeacon` requests are properly processed

## Related Info
- This bug was introduced in commit 606f5282 (2025-07-01)
- Implemented in PR #9 "Add comment export feature on process termination"

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-authored-by: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Implemented Gerrit-style word highlighting feature for the diff viewer
When hovering over a word, all occurrences of that word are highlighted throughout the visible diff
Helps track variable usage and identify patterns in code reviews

Implementation Details

Created WordHighlightContext for global state management
Extended PrismSyntaxHighlighter with EnhancedPrismSyntaxHighlighter to preserve syntax highlighting
Added 200ms hover delay to avoid accidental highlights
Case-insensitive word matching
Supports both light and dark themes
Handles XML/HTML tokens that contain multiple words

Test Plan

 Unit tests for word detection logic
 Unit tests for WordHighlightContext
 Unit tests for EnhancedPrismSyntaxHighlighter
 Manual testing in both light and dark modes
 Verified no regression in existing syntax highlighting
 Tested with various file types (JS, TS, HTML, etc.)
 Verified memory leak prevention with proper cleanup

Screenshots
The implementation matches Gerrit's behavior with a yellow highlight on hover.

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

messageHeadline: feat: Add stdin support for reading unified diffs (#58)
messageBody:
- Automatically detect piped input (\!process.stdin.isTTY)
- Support explicit stdin mode with '-' argument
- Reuse existing parseUnifiedDiff method for parsing
- Add parseStdinDiff method that handles diffs without git summary
- Extract countLinesFromChunks helper to avoid code duplication
- Add comprehensive tests for stdin functionality
- Update README with usage examples

This enables powerful pipeline workflows:
- git diff | npx difit
- git diff -U10 | npx difit
- git diff --merge-base main feature | npx difit
- diff -u file1 file2 | npx difit

nodes.title: feat: Add stdin support for reading unified diffs
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
This PR adds support for reading unified diffs from stdin, enabling powerful pipeline workflows with difit.
Features

Automatic detection: Detects piped input via \!process.stdin.isTTY
Explicit mode: Use - argument to force reading from stdin
Full compatibility: Reuses existing diff parsing logic for consistency
Flexible workflows: Works with any tool that outputs unified diff format

Usage Examples
# Basic usage - pipe git diff output
git diff | npx difit

# Explicit stdin mode
git diff | npx difit -

# Custom context lines
git diff -U10 | npx difit

# Compare against merge base
git diff --merge-base main feature | npx difit

# View diffs from other tools
diff -u file1.txt file2.txt | npx difit

# Review saved patches
cat changes.patch | npx difit
Implementation Details

Added readStdin() function to read from process.stdin
Created parseStdinDiff() method that leverages existing parseUnifiedDiff()
Extracted countLinesFromChunks() helper to avoid code duplication
Added comprehensive test coverage in git-diff.test.ts
Updated server to handle pre-parsed diff data from stdin

Test Plan

 Added 9 new test cases for stdin parsing functionality
 Added unit test for countLinesFromChunks helper
 All existing tests pass (209 passed)
 Manual testing with various diff sources
 ESLint and TypeScript checks pass

Notes

Syntax highlighting works as expected (language detection from filenames in diff)
Comments work but use a generic storage key since there's no git commit hash
Image diffs cannot be displayed (no access to actual file content)

nodes.title: fix: handle empty files in keyboard navigation
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Fixed keyboard navigation to properly handle empty files and chunks
Prevents navigation from getting stuck when encountering files with no content
Added comprehensive test coverage for empty file scenarios

Problem
Keyboard navigation would break in rare cases when encountering:

Empty files (files with no chunks)
Files with empty chunks (chunks with no lines)

This can occur in edge cases such as:

Files temporarily added with git add -N (intent to add) that are later deleted
Certain diff scenarios where files exist but have no actual content changes
Other rare cases where the diff parser produces empty chunks/lines

Solution
Modified the advancePosition function in navigationCore.ts to:

Continue advancing through empty files/chunks instead of returning invalid positions
Properly wrap around when all files are empty (to prevent infinite loops)
Skip to the next file with actual content when normal advancement fails

Test plan

 Added comprehensive tests for empty file scenarios
 All existing tests pass
 Linting passes
 Manually tested keyboard navigation with empty files

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

nodes.title: Add Hot Reload Feature with File Watching and Manual Refresh
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
Added a hot reload feature that automatically detects repository changes and provides a GitHub-style manual reload button. This implementation uses high-performance file watching with mode-aware monitoring strategies.
difit --watch

  
    
    

    2025-07-22.at.12.09.31.mp4
    
  

  

  


difit . --watch

  
    
    

    2025-07-22.at.12.13.41.mp4
    
  

  

  


Key Features

Automatic Change Detection: Monitors file changes and commits based on diff mode
GitHub-style Reload Button: Orange-colored reload button that appears when changes are detected
Smart Mode-aware Watching: Different monitoring strategies for each diff mode (DEFAULT, WORKING, STAGED, DOT)
Gitignore Support: Respects .gitignore patterns when watching working directory
Real-time Communication: Server-Sent Events (SSE) for instant change notifications
Comprehensive Testing: 265 test cases covering all components and edge cases

Usage
Enable file watching by adding the --watch flag to any difit command:
# Watch for new commits when viewing HEAD diff
difit --watch

# Watch for file changes when viewing working directory
difit . --watch

# Watch for staging changes
difit working --watch

# Watch for uncommitted changes (files + commits)
difit HEAD main --watch
When changes are detected, an orange "Reload" button appears next to the "Ignore Whitespace" toggle. Click it to refresh the diff view with the latest changes.
Note: The --watch flag is currently supported only in GUI mode. TUI support will be added in future releases.
Design Decisions

Manual Reload vs Auto-reload: Chose manual reload button over automatic refresh to prevent disrupting the review experience when AI tools are running in the background
GUI-first Implementation: Started with GUI support as it provides better user experience for the reload button. TUI support is planned for future releases

Implementation Details
Architecture Overview
┌─────────────────┐    SSE     ┌──────────────────┐    File Events    ┌─────────────────┐
│   React Client  │ ◄────────► │   Express Server │ ◄───────────────► │ @parcel/watcher │
│                 │            │                  │                   │                 │
│ - ReloadButton  │            │ - FileWatcher    │                   │ - .git/HEAD     │
│ - useFileWatch  │            │ - SSE Endpoint   │                   │ - .git/index    │
│ - App.tsx       │            │ - Cache Manager  │                   │ - Working files │
└─────────────────┘            └──────────────────┘                   └─────────────────┘

File Watching Strategy by Mode

DEFAULT Mode: Watches .git/HEAD for new commits
WORKING Mode: Watches working directory + staging area for file changes
STAGED Mode: Watches .git/index for staging changes
DOT Mode: Watches working directory + commits for uncommitted changes
SPECIFIC Mode: No watching (static commit comparison)

Core Components

FileWatcherService: High-performance file monitoring with @parcel/watcher
ReloadButton: GitHub-style UI component with loading states
useFileWatch: React hook for SSE communication and state management
Type System: Comprehensive TypeScript definitions for watch events

Changes Made
New Files

src/types/watch.ts - Shared type definitions for watch functionality
src/server/file-watcher.ts - Core file watching service implementation
src/client/hooks/useFileWatch.ts - React hook for file watch integration
src/client/components/ReloadButton.tsx - GitHub-style reload button component

Enhanced Files

src/server/server.ts - Added SSE endpoint and cache invalidation
src/client/App.tsx - Integrated reload button with keyboard navigation
src/cli/index.ts - Added --watch flag and diff mode detection

Test Coverage

29 ReloadButton tests: Visibility, states, interactions, accessibility
13 useFileWatch tests: SSE connection, reconnection, error handling
14 FileWatcherService tests: Mode-specific watching, gitignore, debouncing
Additional CLI tests: Watch functionality and mode detection

Technical Highlights

Debounced Change Detection (300ms): Prevents excessive reload notifications
Gitignore Integration: Uses simple-git's checkIgnore for accurate file filtering
Auto-reconnection: SSE connections automatically recover from network issues
Orange Color Scheme: Matches GitHub's design language for reload buttons
Memory Efficient: Proper cleanup of watchers and event listeners

🤖 Generated with Claude Code
Co-Authored-By: Claude noreply@anthropic.com

nodes.title: feat: Add support for @ symbol as Git HEAD alias
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Add support for @ symbol as a Git HEAD alias in difit
Allow @ with parent/ancestor references like @^, @~3, etc.
Fix validation that was explicitly rejecting @ despite it being a valid Git reference

Changes

Updated validateCommitish function to recognize @ patterns with regex /^@(~\d+|\^\d*)*$/
Removed explicit rejection of @ from isValidBranchName function
Added comprehensive tests for @ symbol usage
Updated README with @ usage examples

Test plan

 Added new test cases for @, @^, @~1, @~2^1 etc.
 All existing tests pass
 Manually verified git log -1 @ and git log -1 @~3 work correctly
 Build and lint checks pass

Why this matters
Git has supported @ as an alias for HEAD since version 1.8.5. This is a common shorthand that many Git users expect to work. The previous validation was unnecessarily restrictive.
Example usage:
npx difit @          # Same as npx difit HEAD
npx difit @ main     # Compare HEAD with main
npx difit @^ @~3     # Compare previous commit with 3 commits ago

nodes.title: feat: Add Gerrit-style keyboard navigation
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
This PR introduces comprehensive Gerrit-style keyboard navigation to difit, enabling users to efficiently navigate through diffs using keyboard shortcuts. The implementation includes visual cursor highlighting, smart scrolling, and a help modal.

Key Features
🎯 Navigation Commands

Line Navigation: j/k or ↓/↑ - Navigate between diff lines
File Navigation: ]/[ - Jump between files
Chunk Navigation: n/p - Navigate between change chunks (added/deleted lines)
Comment Navigation: N/P (Shift+n/p) - Jump between comments
Side Navigation: h/l or ←/→ - Switch between left/right sides (side-by-side mode only)

🔧 Actions

Review Toggle: r - Mark file as reviewed/unreviewed (with auto-scroll to file header)
Add Comment: c - Create comment at current line (not on deleted lines)
Copy Comments: Shift+C - Copy all comments prompt to clipboard
Center View: . - Move cursor to center of viewport
Help: ? - Toggle keyboard shortcuts help modal

🎨 Visual Improvements

Visual cursor highlighting with blue outline (#4d7adb)
Responsive 2-column help modal layout on larger screens (≥1024px)
Smart scrolling that positions focused elements at 1/3 from top
Skip collapsed/reviewed files during navigation

🔨 Technical Improvements

Modular architecture with separate files for navigation logic
Comprehensive test coverage (1000+ lines of tests)
Filter-based navigation system for extensibility
Proper handling of side-by-side vs inline modes
Mouse click integration to set cursor position

Implementation Details
The keyboard navigation is implemented using:

A custom React hook (useKeyboardNavigation) that manages cursor state
Filter-based navigation system that makes it easy to define navigation targets
Smart scrolling behavior inspired by Gerrit's implementation
Proper handling of edge cases (deleted lines, paired add/delete lines, etc.)

Test plan

 All existing tests pass
 Added comprehensive test suite for keyboard navigation (24 test cases)
 Pre-commit hooks pass (format, typecheck, test, lint)
 Manual testing of all keyboard shortcuts
 Manual testing in both side-by-side and inline modes
 Manual testing of help modal responsiveness
 Manual testing with large diffs

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

nodes.title: feat: Add ability to delete all existing comments
nodes.bodyText:
Thank you for creating difit! It's an incredibly useful tool for code reviews. This PR adds functionality to help manage comments across multiple review sessions.
Problem
When using difit for multiple review sessions:

Comments from previous sessions remain visible even after code changes
Comments on lines that no longer exist in the diff cannot be deleted through the UI
There's no way to start a fresh review session without old comments

Solution
This PR introduces two ways to delete all existing comments:
1. UI Button - "Delete All Comments"

Added a red button next to "Copy All Comments" button
Shows confirmation dialog before deletion
Allows users to clear all comments during a review session

2. CLI Flag - --clean

Start difit with a clean slate by clearing all existing comments on startup
Usage: difit --clean
Only clears comments once on initial load (new comments added during the session are not affected)

Implementation Details

Modified useLocalComments hook to expose the existing clearAllComments function
Added confirmation dialog using window.confirm() for safety
Used useRef to ensure CLI flag only triggers cleanup once
Added comprehensive tests for both UI and CLI functionality

Testing

Added tests for useLocalComments hook
Added tests for App component (UI button functionality)
Added tests for CLI flag functionality
All existing tests pass

Breaking Changes
None. This is a purely additive feature.

message:

When displaying files with collapsed single-child directories
(e.g., src/client/components/),
the root node was being collapsed which caused files to appear at
the wrong level.
This fix ensures the full folder structure is preserved when only
one file is changed.

messageHeadline: Fix file status display to show line edits as modified
messageBody:
Changed file status determination logic:
- Only show "added" for new files (new file mode or /dev/null)
- Only show "deleted" for deleted files (deleted file mode or /dev/null)
- All other line edits now show as "modified"
- Removed logic that showed files as added/deleted based solely on line additions/deletions

Based on user request: いま左のファイルリスト、ファイルに追加行だけなら追加、削除行だけなら削除になってるけど、行編集はすべてmodifiedにして、新規ファイル追加だけを追加、既存ファイル削除だけを削除表示にしてほしい

4. 動作確認とテスト

messageHeadline: Implement proper Git branch name validation rules
messageBody:
- Replace simple regex with comprehensive Git ref format validation
- Add isValidBranchName function following git check-ref-format rules
- Forbid: starting with dash, ending with dot, consecutive dots, @{ sequence,
  consecutive slashes, leading/trailing slashes, .lock suffix, control chars,
  ~^:?*[\ characters, components starting with dot
- Allow: @, +, =, \!, ,, ;, quotes and other valid characters
- Add comprehensive test cases for valid and invalid branch names
- Ensure compatibility with actual Git branch naming conventions

nodes.title: Add multi-line comment support for diff viewer
nodes.bodyText:
Overview
This PR introduces multi-line comment functionality to the diff viewer, allowing users to select and comment on multiple lines of code at once.



Side by Side
Inline









Changes

Enhanced the diff viewer components to support multi-line selection
Updated comment handling logic to work with line ranges instead of single lines
Modified the SideBySideDiffChunk component to handle multi-line comment interactions
Updated the comment data structure to support line ranges
Added visual styling for multi-line selections
Breaking Change: Updated comment position format from <path>:<line> to <path>:L<line> for single lines and <path>:L<line>-L<line> for multi-line ranges (following GitHub's line reference format)

e.g. https://github.com/yoshiko-pg/difit/blob/main/package.json#L2
e.g. https://github.com/yoshiko-pg/difit/blob/main/package.json#L2-L5



Affected Components

DiffViewer: Main diff viewer component updated to handle multi-line comments
SideBySideDiffChunk: Added logic for multi-line selection and comment creation
InlineComment: Updated to work with line ranges
useLocalComments: Modified hook to handle multi-line comment data
Comment type definitions updated to support line ranges

Benefits

Users can now comment on blocks of code instead of individual lines
Improves code review efficiency by allowing contextual comments across multiple lines
Better aligns with standard code review workflows

nodes.title: Add image diff display support
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Add support for displaying image files in diff view with side-by-side comparison
Show image dimensions and file sizes below each image
Add checkerboard background pattern for transparent images
Support both inline and side-by-side display modes
Handle added, deleted, and modified image files appropriately
Support various image formats including PNG, JPG, SVG, WebP, ICO, etc.
Use actual commit references instead of hardcoded HEAD/HEAD~1

Features Added

Image Detection: Automatically detect image files by extension and display them with ImageDiffChunk component
Visual Comparison: Display before/after images side-by-side in both inline and side-by-side modes
Image Information: Show dimensions (W: 800px | H: 168px) and file size (1.2 KB) below each image
Transparency Support: Gray and white checkerboard background pattern for transparent images
File Status Support: Proper handling of added, deleted, and modified image files with appropriate labels
Large File Support: Handle images up to 10MB with proper error messaging for oversized files
Commit Reference Support: Use actual base/target commit references passed from diff arguments
Special Case Handling: Support for working directory (.) and staged files (staged) references

Technical Implementation

Created ImageDiffChunk.tsx component for image diff display
Added imageUtils.ts for image file detection by extension
Extended server /api/blob/* endpoint to serve image files with proper binary handling
Added getBlobContent method to GitDiffParser using git cat-file for proper binary data retrieval
Improved file status detection logic to properly identify added/deleted files using git diff headers
Added cache-control headers to prevent image caching issues
Increased maxBuffer limit to 10MB for large image files

Test Plan

 Test image display in both inline and side-by-side modes
 Verify added, deleted, and modified image files display correctly
 Check image size information is displayed accurately
 Test transparent images show checkerboard background
 Verify various image formats (PNG, JPG, SVG, WebP, ICO) work
 Test large file handling and error messages
 Verify commit reference handling works with actual commit arguments
 Test working directory and staged file references

🤖 Generated with Claude Code

nodes.title: Fix git diff header parsing to handle paths without prefix
nodes.bodyText:
Problem
Currently, the git diff header parsing fails when git is configured with diff.noprefix=true. This configuration removes the a/ and b/ prefixes from file paths in diff output, causing the regex to not match and breaking the diff parsing functionality.
Example
With default git config (works):
diff --git a/src/file.js b/src/file.js

With diff.noprefix=true (currently broken):
diff --git src/file.js src/file.js

Solution
Updated the regex pattern to make the a/ and b/ prefixes optional using non-capturing groups (?:[a-z]\/)?, allowing the parser to handle both formats correctly.
Impact

✅ Maintains backward compatibility with default git configuration
✅ Adds support for diff.noprefix=true configuration
✅ Makes the tool more robust across different git setups
✅ No breaking changes to existing functionality

This change ensures the tool works consistently regardless of the user's git configuration.
🤖 Generated with Claude Code

messageHeadline: Simplify TUI mode handling by unifying with web client
messageBody:
Replaced TUI's internal 'diff' mode with 'inline' to match web client:
- Changed TUI viewMode type from 'list' | 'diff' | 'side-by-side' to 'list' | 'inline' | 'side-by-side'
- Removed complex mode mapping logic in TUI App component
- Updated StatusBar component to use 'inline' instead of 'diff'
- Simplified initial viewMode setting: mode === 'inline' ? 'inline' : 'side-by-side'
- Updated help text: 'd: unified diff' → 'd: inline diff'
- Updated StatusBar display: 'Unified Diff' → 'Inline Diff'

Benefits:
- Eliminates mode mapping complexity
- Unifies terminology between web and TUI clients
- Simplifies maintenance and reduces code duplication
- Makes mode handling more intuitive

Both clients now use consistent mode values:
- Web: 'inline' | 'side-by-side'
- TUI: 'inline' | 'side-by-side' (plus 'list' for file navigation)

Test results: 75 tests total (73 passed, 2 skipped)

nodes.title: Fix diff display issue when non-default git diff tool is set
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
#19
I have fixed an issue where reviewIt could not display diffs when an external diff tool was configured in Git. For more details, please refer to the issue above.
what I changed

To ensure consistent output results, I have adjusted the options to use our original Diff tool instead of relying on external Diff tools.

Manual Test Result

$ git config --global --get diff.external
difft --background=light

On branch fix/no-ext-diff

vite v7.0.0 building for production...

built in 1.51s

nodes.title: Add untracked file detection with CLI prompt
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
git diff doesn't show untracked files, which is inconvenient for this tool's purpose.
Added a check for untracked files at CLI startup.
If any are found, the user is prompted for confirmation before adding them to git's index using git add --intent-to-add.
Prompt examples
User says "yes":
📝 Found 1 untracked file(s):
    - difftest.txt

❓ Would you like to include these untracked files in the diff review? (y/N): y
✅ Files added with --intent-to-add
   💡 To undo this, run `git reset --mixed`

User says "no"(default):
❓ Would you like to include these untracked files in the diff review? (y/N): n
ℹ️ Untracked files will not be shown in diff

Test

 Confirm untracked files appear in diff with "Yes"
 Confirm untracked files do not appear in diff with "No"
 Show diff with tui
 git reset --mixed returns files to an untracked state

nodes.title: feat: Add --host option to configure server bind address
nodes.bodyText:
Summary

Added --host option to configure server bind address
Enables external access to ReviewIt diff viewer when needed
Maintains secure localhost-only default for backward compatibility

Features

New --host <host> CLI option with default value 127.0.0.1
Support for binding to specific IP addresses or 0.0.0.0 for external access
Smart URL generation (displays localhost when host is 0.0.0.0)
Preserves existing port fallback logic with specified host
Updated documentation with usage examples

Usage
# Default behavior (localhost only)
reviewit HEAD

# Allow external access
reviewit --host 0.0.0.0 HEAD

# Bind to specific IP address
reviewit --host 192.168.1.100 HEAD

# Combine with other options
reviewit --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8080 HEAD
Implementation Details

Extended CliOptions interface to include optional host property
Updated ServerOptions interface in server module to accept host parameter
Modified startServerWithFallback function to use configurable host instead of hardcoded 127.0.0.1
Enhanced URL generation logic to handle 0.0.0.0 display as localhost for better UX
Updated README.md with CLI options table and usage examples

Test plan

 CLI help displays --host option correctly
 TypeScript compilation passes with new interfaces
 All existing tests continue to pass
 Linting and formatting checks pass
 Default behavior unchanged when --host not specified
 Backward compatibility maintained

🤖 Generated with https://claude.ai/code

nodes.title: (patch) Fix port fallback behavior
nodes.bodyText:
Summary
In v1.1.7, There are bugs when the prefered port is in-use.

Printing localhost:undefined as the listening server address.
Opening browser doesn't work

reproduce bug

launch a some server on port 3000
run npx reviewit
The server log prints http://localhost:undefined in stdout

Port 3000 is busy, trying 3001...

🚀 ReviewIt server started on http://localhost:undefined
📋 Reviewing: HEAD
🌐 Opening browser...

What I changed
Express v5 passes an Error instance to the callback function for listen method. https://expressjs.com/en/guide/migrating-5.html#app.listen
By using this feature, we can do error handling more easier and simple than server.on('error', ....
Now, the fallback port is printed correctly and opening browser works.
Port 3000 is busy, trying 3001...

🚀 ReviewIt server started on http://localhost:3001
📋 Reviewing: HEAD
🌐 Opening browser...

messageHeadline: Add compare-with option support
messageBody:
- Added optional [compare-with] argument to CLI for flexible diff comparisons
- Split internal commitish parameter into targetCommitish and baseCommitish
- Added comprehensive validation logic with unified validateDiffArguments function
- Created shortHash utility function for consistent hash truncation
- Added complete test suite for validation functions
- Moved tests to same directory structure as source files
- Updated documentation with new CLI usage examples

Key features:
- Special arguments (working, staged, .) only allowed in target position
- Working directory shows unstaged changes only, cannot be compared with other commits

nodes.title: fix: improve build scripts in package.json
nodes.bodyText:
個別のtscコマンドをtsc -bに置き換え、プロジェクトリファレンスを正しくビルド出来るように修正しました。それに伴って、冗長になったビルドコマンドの削除も行いました。

build: pnpm run build:cli && tsc -> tsc -b
tsconfig.jsonで参照されたtsconfig.cli.jsonがビルドされるようになります
start: 不要になったbuild:cli呼び出しを削除
typecheck: tsc --noEmit -> tsc -b
以前までcliのビルドを行っていなかったところを行うように修正しました。tsconfig.jsonには元々noEmit: trueが設定されているため、この変更でpnpm run build:cli && tsc --noEmitと同じような効果が得られるはずです
prepublishOnly: 不要になったbuild:cli呼び出しを削除

messageHeadline: TUI (#2)
messageBody:
* feat: add TUI mode for terminal-based diff viewing

- Add React Ink-based terminal UI with --tui option
- Support side-by-side and unified diff views
- Navigate files with Tab/Shift+Tab (with looping)
- Vim-style keybindings (j/k for scroll)
- Default to showing uncommitted changes (working directory)
- Add --staged and --dirty flags for TUI mode
- Share core git-diff functionality between web and TUI
- Display file preview navigation and remaining lines count

Usage:
  reviewit --tui              # Show uncommitted changes
  reviewit --tui --staged     # Show staged changes
  reviewit --tui HEAD~3       # Show specific commit

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>

* Fix TUI runtime errors and add proper error handling

- Add error handling for empty files array in SideBySideDiffViewer
- Add display for when no files are found
- Add TTY environment check before starting TUI mode
- Prevent crashes when currentFile is undefined

* Improve file navigation display in TUI

- Rename git-diff-simple.ts to git-diff-tui.ts for clarity
- Add 'r' key to reload diff data
- Improve file navigation display with 2-line limit
- Show current file in brackets with surrounding files
- Dim inactive files and handle overflow gracefully
- Update help text to show reload key

* Fix CLI build configuration

- Add explicit noEmit: false and declaration: true
- Restore proper CLI build output to dist/cli/

* Add type definitions for CLI options

- Define CliOptions interface for better type safety
- Remove unsafe any type usage in CLI action handler

---------

- Tailwind設定ファイル作成とGitHub風ダークテーマ色設定
- Vite設定からCSS Modules削除してTailwind対応
- 全7個のCSS Moduleファイル削除とTailwindクラス移行:
  - App.module.css → App.tsx
  - FileList.module.css → FileList.tsx
  - DiffViewer.module.css → DiffViewer.tsx
  - DiffChunk.module.css → DiffChunk.tsx
  - SideBySideDiffChunk.module.css → SideBySideDiffChunk.tsx
  - InlineComment.module.css → InlineComment.tsx
  - CommentForm.module.css → CommentForm.tsx
- global.cssをTailwindディレクティブに変更
- PostCSS設定でTailwind v4対応

- CSS変数とTailwindの arbitrary values活用でテーマ維持
- GitHub風UIデザインの完全再現
- バンドルサイズの最適化
- 開発効率の向上

- SideBySideDiffChunk.tsxでコメントIDベースの重複除去ロジックを実装
- Map を使用して同じIDのコメントを自動的に重複除去
- 左右両方の行番号が同じ場合のコメント二重表示問題を解決
- インラインモードは影響なし、サイドバイサイドモードのみ修正
